If you are looking for a better place at a reasonable price in Verona, go to the HyVee restaurant (just next to the HyVee grocery store).
The food was delivered quickly and was very good. Rob was our server and was very attentive even though he was also serving a large party.

When family ask to go out for pancakes for breakfast they name this place. And I think of a place in Nashville where people stand outdoors in line for an hour, before making it to the indoors line where dozens of pancake variations are served, and I wonder when will I next get back there?!  And that we need more authentic breakfast places on the west side!   With pancake in the name I expect varied selects. Don't count on it here. The sausage patty is the best thing available food wise. I only give in to the family on the "breakfast out" request so I can get the fresh squeezed orange juice. 2 stars for that!

Living in the area(and loving breakfast) I totally wish I could like this place.   I just can't do it.  I feel that Pancake Cafe is a more quantity over quality establishment. Yes, you get a crazy amount of food...but it isn't even good enough to make me want to take my leftovers.  It weirds me out that the omelets  come out so toasty brown. By the time an egg gets brown it is wayyyyy overcooked. The puffy, dry texture is strange. I like a light, airy, MOIST egg. The veggie crepes I got were filled with a heavy, fake tasting cheese sauce--and were supposed to be covered in hollandaise but I thankfully had asked to get it on the side. My crepes would have been soup, and the poor spinach and mushrooms were already having a tough time of it in their cheese goo. We also got a side of crazy expensive bacon--which was so thick that it was more chewy than crispy and not worth the cash.  Maybe I should try the pancakes?

This place deserves a five star review because the food was awesome and the waitress was very friendly. What more do you need really?  In our table for two, we both ordered the Country Fried Steak, eggs, potatoes, and pancakes.  A huge breakfast and all 4 parts of it were perfect.  They offered this monstrous meal for only $9.99.  Also, I love when diners do this, they left the big pot of coffee on the table for us to refill ourselves.  Very convenient.  If I find myself in this neighborhood around breakfast again, I will be sure to pop in.
This place is pretty good.  We had to wait a while (which was a little odd because it was a late Monday morning) but the food was good.  Good portions for the money.

What in the world happened to this place?    The food was never that spectacular - the standard Denny's or IHOP menu with better quality ingredients.  Now the line for the place is out the door as people wait for mediocre food.  The worst part is that the wait is SOLELY due to poor wait staff.  The service is just about as bad as it can get.  It literally takes 10-15 minutes to take and fill a drink order.  Then another 20 minutes to fill the food orders.  People should be flying through a breakfast diner since the food isn't difficult to prepare and should be extremely fast.  Instead this place is bottlenecked by poor service.  If you're looking for a breakfast joint, don't think that you're getting a better experience or extraordinarily better food because of the wait.  Hit up an IHOP or, better yet, if you're in the City by Camp Randall, check out Mickey's Dairy Bar.

This place isn't bad. But there's really nothing that makes it any better than any other breakfast place. It's like an overpriced IHOP... Not that I'm dissing IHOP, I like it just fine. There's just nothing special. Pancake Cafe does have great thick cut bacon, but a lot of dishes don't come with it and its super expensive if you get it a la carte.  The wait at Pancake Cafe on a weekend morning is borderline unbearable. Expect a 45 minute wait on a Sunday for brunch.. And it just isn't worth it.

Well the best thing I can say about this place is it has super fast service, even on busy weekend mornings. The eggs benedict are also halfway decent. Everything else is typical breakfast food and you will not be impressed. The German pancake and the large apple pecan thingy are huge so get the small ones if you must, but I don't recommend either. Don't be freaked by the 5 in the 5 egg omelets, they aren't as enormous as you would think
One of the worst customer service places I have been to since Hubbard dinner. Waited 10 mins for a server and 20 for pancakes. Average food

Yep, the Pancake Cafe is where it's at on Madison's west side for breakfast on the weekends. Everything they make is a.) huge and b.) delicious. Families with kids go there. Old people go there. Hungover college kids go there. People bring in their one-night stand (you know who you are) for french toast and the short kiss goodbye. That's because it has this great ambiance of absolutely casual and really good. They freshly squeeze their own orange juice. They serve coffee (decent) with heavy cream, not half and half in garbagey little plastic containers. Frankly, I think their cheeseburgers are the best in Madison as well. These are just examples. The list goes on and on - it's a quality establishment.  Source of amusement: a fireplace in the waiting area that has a sign on it reading, "Caution: Hot." Hee hee!  Listen though, the Pancake Cafe is a zoo on Saturday and Sunday mornings. Get ready for a seriously long wait. It can even be out the door sometimes. People aren't stupid, they know delicious french toast when they eat it and fresh strawberries and unbelievable apple poufs as big as your goddamned head. Go!
My husband and I love coming here! The food is great and the service is amazing! Fast and very friendly!

Ate there for the first time this morning, what a disappointment, they served me raw eggs and when I complained the waiter was pretty nasty about it. He took them back but he took a long time to bring me new ones and they where burned. If you're in the Madison, WI area, find somewhere else to eat, this place is a disgrace.

Looks like I made another mistake by trying this place out again. This establishment is absolutely one of the worst in all of Madison.  I arrived with a party of 4 at 10.15 am, the restaurant was practically empty, yet after 45 min we had not yet been served and every dish was eggs of one sort or another. The waitress explained when I asked to talk to a manager that he was working at a different location and they only had 1 cook on duty and they were going as fast as they can. She then proceeded to bring out 2 of the 4 orders, then a few minutes later the 3rd of the 4th order, and then NOTHING!. When she finally arrived with my order, I refused it as everyone else were almost done with their breakfasts. The quality of the 3 orders that were delivered, were sub par, to say the least. None of the eggs were cut as ordered.  This restaurant is a prime example of a restaurant owner who cares nothing about his customers, the service, or the quality of the food that he serves. I'm sure that cleanliness of the back of the house most be disastrous as well.   Nobody that was working in this restaurant today gave one wit about what they threw out on the table. Pancake Caf is a must miss, don't waste your money, they should shut it down, its a disgrace!

The other Yelpers are correct about (1) the Groupon issue and I followed every rule; (2) the pancakes have a gritty batter; (3) the kid would not recommend this place only days after our 1st ever visit but said she would go again (Look! I don't get that at all). Maybe it's to get something else (I did wanted to try a burger).   In the end, I'm good.... as in I'm good with never going back. The Dayton Street Grille in the Concourse Hotel has locally sourced, hand-cut bacon, Marigold has decent waffles & if we're in a real pinch IHOP is a locally-owned and operated franchise on University Ave. I will acknowledge I liked the bacon but I won't take chances for bacon.  Went last week Friday morning at 8:45a as RSVP'd. Met by an indifferent hostess. Looks like a teenager that doesn't want to be at work. No soap in the ladies bathroom. I went into the men's room and was watched (by an older server) as I entered and exited. No one spoke up so I spoke. "HELLO. How are you this morning?" Got an answer. Then proffered when I was questioned: "there's no soap in the ladies restroom." THE PLACE WAS NOT BUSY AT ALL & THERE WERE 5 SERVERS PLUS 1 HOSTESS. What gives?  They overcharged me. I had to call in to get it straighten out. I wanted to believe it was a mistake but nope!
Okay place for breakfast.  Ate here on 3/29/16.  Was surprised how few customers.  Waffle was far from special.  Okay, but certainly expected something better.

You can't really go wrong with The Pancake Cafe!  The food is always good and the staff is nothing but friendly.  I came here last weekend for breakfast and got the corned beef hash with eggs, hashbrown's and pancakes for like $9.00!  The food was good and the service is consistently good.  My buddy wasn't so happy however!  He ordered the corned beef hash also but he ordered the Swedish pancakes instead.  We laughed because the pancake looked more like pancake skin instead of actual pancakes!  On the plus side the berries on the side were really good.  I have tried a few other things on their menu such as their bacon pancakes and their ham and eggs and love both items!  They also seriously have THE best orange juice ever!  It is fresh squeezed and never sour!  I come to The Pancake Cafe every few months but don't go too often because the wait is usually really long.  They offer Groupons pretty often so I think that definitely contributes to the long wait times.  The trick here is to go really early to avoid the lines!
A group of us went here at a friend's request. The wait was ridiculous and the food was pretty terrible. Frankly, if you're looking for good breakfast or brunch in the area, you've got other options.

The pancakes are delicious (the best I have had in the Madison area so far). The western baked omlette with chedar cheese is just about the best omlette I have had in my life. The south west omlette was a miss for me...a bit bland, yet spicy. I have eaten here 3 times, so far. I can't wait to try the rest of their menu!

THIS BACON WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE!!! The hash browns and eggs were good and the pancakes were ok, but the bacon was legitimately the best I've ever had at a breakfast diner. There are literally not words to describe this bacon! I'm not a huge bacon fanatic but the waitress told me it was the most popular menu item and her recommendation did NOT disappoint. This will be my go-to breakfast venue solely because of the bacon. I know some think the menu is a bit expensive, but you actually get a shocking amount of food for the price--$10 purchases three large pancakes, hash browns, bacon and two over easy eggs.

The service here has always been great but the food itself is just okay. The atmosphere is bright and lively. Since a lot of families like to come here for breakfast, it's very busy in the mornings so expect a bit of a wait if you're coming in at that time. The prices are pretty reasonable, too. But, ultimately, the food being as average as it is means that this is a place that I'm happy to come to if my friends want to go but not really a place I'd crave to go to.

So my sister prefaced our visit with a, "so when we get inside, it's going to look really weird and dumpy, but the food is really good". I'd say it was a super accurate description. The interior tries to be nice and bright with some yellow paint on the walls. They got into the holiday spirit with a tree and pictures wrapped like presents on the wall but it still just didn't feel like it was tied together.  Our server was super soft spoken to the point where we actually wondered if she said anything. We still received decent service it was just more the silent type. Food was great. Their pancakes are fantastic and accompany the omelettes if you choose to order that. I ordered a bacon cheese omelette and was pleased with it. The environment and lack of verbal communication causes this review to lose a couple stars, but the food is good.
Quick service but food was so so. Not quite that homemade feel to the food so it was average. The place was near our hotel so we stopped in but will look for somewhere else next time.

A fine place for their ... well, everything !  I've had pancakes, waffles, & omelettes; all are delicious & satisfying.  Their bacon is unusually appealing - thick and well-cured.  Each tab or table has its own pot o'great coffee, too.  The Gammon Road restaurant might be too bright for some folks, but there's no faulting their breakfast fare or space for diners.  I've never felt as if other diners were too close, either.  There's a WSJ on the counter (there's a breakfast counter w/moveable stools !), a happy manager who LIKES her job, and great servers to round out the appeal.                                           A N D  Off-street parking !  Mickey's is tasty, but parking there leaves me cold.  I guess I just like-a me some Pancake Caf bacon and waffle w/pecans  ~  IJDGNB !
Apple pancake, fresh squeezed orange juice & thick crispy bacon make this place worth going to.   So good!

Just moving back to Madison and wanting to get out of our normal routine of food chains I noticed this place while driving to woodmans. They boast quite a few Madisons Best awards so we headed on over.   Coffee is great!   Pancakes were more on the dense side with a good flavor.    Staff was sweet and got everything correct on the first go.   I ordered the eggs beni.  Im a eggs beni snob. This was damn good.  The hollandaise can make or break it and this was perfect. Eggs were done well and the set up was well put together. Ive seen some sloppy eggs beni and this was not one of them.   Husband snagged the corn beef and hash and I of course snuck a bite.  Again..  Pretty tasty.  The only down side was our hashbrowns were under done and not seasoned at all. Im guessing this is their pref to let guest season them on their own.    All in all a solid breakfast spot tucked away at the end of the parking lot.  Well be back.

Went in for a half hour lunch break and ordered some pancakes and a breakfast burrito to go. The woman who helped us was very kind and we ended up getting our food and leaving quite quickly, especially for it being noon! An excellent breakfast and lunch menu with reasonable prices. I got the pumpkin pancakes and did not regret it--they were fluffy, flavorful, and overall incredible. Amazing breakfast burrito for the fiance, too. I would love to come here again, the atmosphere looks warm and inviting!

Food grade: B+ Good food. Good presentation.  They could use some re-training in preparing eggs. The waffle with fresh fruit is great. I love the fresh squeezed orange juice!! Service staff is nice and polite!

The layout of this building is strange. You enter through the door, and you kinda have to make your way around to get to the table where you stand there awkwardly until someone realizes that you're there to eat. I ordered a Very Berry crepe dish. It was out within a few minutes (which I thought was very, very strange considering crepes usually take quite a while to make) and it was a soggy mess with powdered sugar which looked like someone just quickly threw it on the crepes, and berry juice all over the bottom of the plate. I couldn't believe what I was seeing. Before I even ate the crepes, it looked unappetizing. And the maple syrup: it had absolutely no flavor to it and I felt like I was just eating a soggy mess.   I left very unsatisfied. Even Denny's is better than this place. For any day except Sunday, I'm just going to stick with Yola's Cafe. I don't know what it is about this area, but this place and the burrito place in the same strip mall have the worst food that I've ever had in Madison.

As a disclaimer, I've only ever had their omelets (low-carb eater here) and they just aren't amazing for the price.  Friends who've come with me order a variety of things and while the consensus was that the food was good, it wasn't out of this world and not really any better than other breakfast joints around.  Go to the Curve if you want a killer omelet. Go just about anywhere else for more bang for your buck.

Atmosphere:  Standard diner type layout.  Not particularly busy but not empty (Saturday afternoon).  Booths are very poorly assembled, scooting forward will pop the entire booth seat up everytime, really irritating.  The place was clean, jam holders refilled and clean with decent options instead of just a bunch of sticky "Mixed Fruit" that you see at a lot of diners.    Menu/Food:  Lots of selection from several different kinds of waffles, pancakes, crepes and omelettes to sandwiches for those in your party that aren't feeling breakfasty.  Food was great.    Price/Portions:  $8-15, depending on how much you get.  Prices on entrees are somewhat on the pricy-side for a diner ($4 for bacon??), especially considering most dishes don't come with entrees.  Omelettes, pancakes and specialty dishes are nicely sized.  Waffles are disappointingly small.    Service:  We were seated right away but it took awhile for the waittress to come in and check with us.  Kind of inconsistant service, as she would refill some of our party's glasses but not others.

My husband loves the apple pancake for some reason. I, on the other hand, do not have a favorite meal here. The place is less than average (for ambiance and food) and I'm surprised at the weekend lines at the door. My 19 year old can make better food than what I've had here.

My boyfriend & I went there for brunch today. I got the chocolate crepes & he got the chocolate chip pancakes. His pancakes were good but my crepes, not so much. They just tasted funny. I've been eating crepes since I was a toddler, & something about these just taste off. The chocolate milk also tasted watery. We got a cinnamon roll to go & that wasn't bad.

So they just redid some renovations with their space and menu and I think it makes the place feel nicer. We have been customers for a few months now and really enjoy their brunch. Though the prices are slightly above average, the serving size is definitely 2 standard deviations above average. I got the steak and eggs, which also comes with 3 gigantic pancakes on the side for $14.99. The steak was beautifully grilled and cooked which was a slight surprise since I was expecting just a pan seared thin slice of steak. But it was a thick and flavorful cut of steak. The pancakes were fluffy and delicious. Come hungry bc the food here will definitely fill you up.
I love their pancake. It's close to my house and I go there almost every weekend.
Great place to meet with a larger group for breakfast or lunch.  Food was good.   Waiter was good with our child.

Came here because I had a 50% off groupon for 2. Overall I was not impressed. There was a 30min wait, typical for Sunday brunch in Madison. Coffee was weak, pancakes were rubbery and looked processed, and the omelette was so-so. It was brown on the surface, which is never good IMHO. BF got the corned beef hash, which also looked processed and was packed into a patty. It was okay, but way too salty. Hash browns were probably the best part of the meal. The portions were certainly large, but who cares if the food isn't any good? If we hadn't had the groupon, I would've had a worse opinion of the place, as our forgettable brunch for two would've cost ~$30 with tip.  Definitely not coming back here given the plethora of brunch places in Madison, most of which offer better food and better prices.

This place gets four stars because of the bacon. When we walked in, the host team was smiles and bubbles and rainbows, good thing too, because our server was not. She was a bit pushy and took my SO's plate while he was still eating. "Do you want a box or can I get that out of your way?" There was definitely a third option. But this place had magical, beautiful bacon.  Thick and juicy, beautiful bacon.

Ugh. Just, ugh.  Avoid eating here.   We stood for 4 minutes in an empty restaurant waiting to be sat. Ok, fine, whatever.   Got sat, ordered food. I got eggs Benedict he got a teriyaki chicken sandwich.   Let's start with him. His sandwich was butchered grilled chicken. Like, the most mangled piece of chicken I've ever seen. I can only assume the "chef" kept cutting into it to make sure it was cooked. Teriyaki was bland and the sandwich itself came with basically nothing on it. Best part, it was on a bun that McDonalds wouldn't even claim as their own.  Mine. I could not eat this thing. It was an abortion of eggs and hollandaise. The eggs were sour, like rotten sour. I got all of one bite in before I couldn't even. I'm sure that one bite is going to make me suffer later too.   Service was good all things considered, but dear god, why would you eat here?

had a wait a while, but it was sunday morning.  the BLT was the thickest bread and bacon i have ever seen.  it looked almost comical.  the freshly squeezed orange juice tasted like sunny-D, but i was reassured that i was wrong.  overall very good place to have brunch with your girlfriend's parents.

The only reason this place got one stars because I can't give it zero stars... I have given this place a chance several times. Let's talk about today's visit... I walk in the place is in that busy I'm by myself I get put in a corner with a menu... 10 minutes goes by, I have not heard from or seen my waitress I haven't got a glass of water, I haven't been offered coffee... However there is a waitress that is tending to a guy kitty corner from me about 6 feet away that came and checked on him three times and never once said hi to me. This place sucks when you get your food it's not cooked right, they don't charge you correctly, and they don't care about your business. Don't waste your time go somewhere else.  Also, the last three visits I made here we're all bad experiences with waitstaff and food. this is an ongoing problem with quality in Madison.

I've been here many, many times for Saturday breakfast after roller derby practice. We usually have a large group (8-12 derby girls) and they never have a problem accommodating. Even with such a large group, we typically wait only 5-10 minutes for a table (except Groupon weekend...).  The Pancake Cafe has a HUGE menu, which can be overwhelming. As Kara W mentioned, they have some original menu items in addition to breakfast staples. Their omelets are good, oven baked, and they offer a nice variety of cheese choices for the omelets. Plates are bountiful and prices are reasonable for the quantity of food. Nothing is gourmet or completely WOW, but you know you'll get a solid breakfast.   Service is friendly but slow at times. Ask for a pot of coffee for your table to "refill your own."
Good brunch. I'd probably choose like 10 places downtown before going out to the west side though. The bacon is great and the staff is nice.
Omelets are my favorite breakfast and the Pancake Cafe has my favorite of all-time. The rest of the food is also great. Big restaurant so wait times are never terribly long.
The food is good and in my opinion fairly priced.  My only issue is the service.  Very slow and most of the staff seems to be high school teens with no training.

Very disappointed with this location. I guess it is worth the wait at Fitchburg location. Dry and unappetizing would describe my experience. Terrible presentation of Swedish pancakes. Couldn't even eat them. My hope the Stoughton location will be better!

Surprised by all the good reviews. I've been here only a couple of times and have been disappointed each time.  There just pancakes...what's the big deal? And why are they SO expensive. Perhaps I should have tried their "famous" pancakes. I think I had strawberry pancakes the last time I was there - nothing exciting, nothing to rave about. And I was short 10+ bucks after the meal...no fun!   The dining room is plain. Actually, I can't even remember what this place looks like, that's how plain it was.  I prefer Monty's or Hubbard Ave for a great, cheap, yummy breakfast.

This place is a step above Perkins/Denny's. They have great service and a standard breakfast menu.  My only gripe if they bake every too many items on the menu. For example a baked omelette. Doesn't taste right.  Pancakes and coffee are great.  My real gripe is with the thick bacon. I like it thin and crispy so I'm always sad when I can't get it.   Anyways my family loves it so we go frequently.

We had a chance to eat at PC Kitchen on South Gammon Road in Madison.  What a fabulous breakfast!  And you simply have to order the bacon!  Service and food was so good that we went back again--we were only in the area for five days-this time for lunch. I ordered the BLT and my husband had chicken. Once again, the food was excellent and service courteous.  I hope that the people who were not happy with the service at pancake Cafe will drive over to South Gammon and give PC Kitchen a whirl.  These Californians were very happy with both food and service.

Food is very good! They lose points in the restrooms. A little on the not so good side there.  That leaves a different impression on the whole experience. Having said that their food really is pretty good.

good selection in breakfast food and nice atmosphere. Good for family dining and very kid friendly (large boothes to accomodate wiggling & worming). corned beef hash and eggs plate, add on the pumpkin pancakes!  Service is hit or miss, unfortunately. Not rude at all, but, the attention to detail and pace of service could be improved. Still best place within 10 miles of me to have breakfast with the family.   My rating is in comparison to similar chain establishments (denny's, iHop, etc) that specialize in breakfast.

So I got the 1-2-3 combo which included fried egg, two slices of bacon, and three small buttermilk pancakes. That's my usual combination and I've gotten it the few times that I've been to this Pancake Cafe in Fitchburg.   The fried egg was decent tasting, and the bacon was a thickly crunchy, but the buttermilk pancake was disappointingly small and dry. Even with syrup (which was on a tray that was doused in syrup that dripped over and made it difficult to lift up the syrup container), the pancake still tasted dry.   Keep in mind that a side off 3 slices of bacon would cost $5.99 (that's $2 a slice for bacon which is quite outrageous). Additionally, we ordered a liter of orange juice to share and that was $9.99 for the bottle (again fairly pricey for juice that didn't seem like it was freshly squeezed, don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad orange juice, it just didn't warrant costing that much!).   Maybe it's just me but somehow all my meals today was disappointing but the meal that my boyfriend got was fairly delicious! I ended up picking off of his plate since his meal tasted better than mine.

Most used place for my family's weekend breakfast. Usually I would get good food with minimal service so I considered the lack of service a norm here. It used to have a slower speed in getting the food ready which has improved a lot recently.  There is not really anything standing out other than the fact there are enough things for you to choose from the menu. However, I heard their soup&sandwich is good for lunch so people may give them a try.

This is my last time here. Working in the food service industry, I can understand getting behind but there's no reason to not get an order of Swedish pancakes and an omelette in a reasonable amount of time.. It took 40 minutes to get the food and it wasn't even busy. The pancakes came out cold. The bacon had a burnt slice and 2 semi raw ones. I sent back both.  The server seemed really busy but again, not a lot of customers. Not really sure what was going on.  My boyfriend's omelette was decent but he was so hungry that he didn't care and ate it all. This place has become a disappointment and we will never return.

I had a great time at Pancake Cafe. It's not a classy restaurant, and that's totally fine. It's a step up from Denny's but it is no brunch on the Square, if that helps put your expectations in check.  We were served fairly quickly. I ordered coffee. I believe they brew Kona Hawaiian coffee. It's nothing special, but they didn't charge a lot for it. It was watered down, but I wasn't disappointed.  I got a half order of Chocolate Chip Pancakes - three pancakes. At first, I was unsure about them because I was expected melted chocolate. Once I realized it was chocolate sauce, I was pleased with my food.  I also got a side of hash browns. They were pretty comparable to Denny's hash browns, so I enjoyed them.
Not aweful and a strong step above a corporate chain but very hard to compare to the other stellar options in the area.  If you like a baked omelet this is your place!

Pancake Cafe was our favorite place to eat Breakfast when they were in Sun Prairie.  We found the Fitchburg location while taking our daughter to UW-Platteville.    We ate there a few times and were never disappointed.  I have tried something from just about every area of the menu and have never been disappointed.  Now, my daughter graduated about a year ago.  We have not had the opportunity to eat there since then as we live too far away.  It is sad to see the more recent reviews.  I hope management there reads these reviews and puts Pancake Cafe back in the same place they were over a year ago.

Good breakfast but horrible brunch. Ruined our Mothers Day. The quality of the food was beyond sub par with powdered eggs frozen hash browns boxed donuts canned veggies and chicken too dry to eat. When asking the manager why the food was not the same quality as the restaurant she began to argue with us. Even the waitress seemed stunned that we thought the food would be the same or similar to the restaurant. We paid $72 for 4 people. My daughter ate 3 pancakes and my husband had 1 piece of ham. I had literally 4 bites and couldn't eat anymore it was just too nasty. What a bait and switch! We love the restaurant but will never ever go to the brunch again.

I really enjoyed this place.  The eggs were honestly the fluffiest egg whites I have ever had.  I loved that they had such a large selection of breakfast items to choose from.  For brunch eaters, this is a great place.  I wasn't impressed the layout and they were a little pricey. The service was excellent though!

This location is surprisingly different than the Fitchburg location. The coffee tastes different as well as the food. I didn't like the tableware as it looked like it hadn't been thoroughly washed at all. If anything I'd recommend users to stick to the Fitchburg location. I am very disappointed in Pancake Cafe for opening a secondary location and not representing themselves in a good way at all.

On our first visit, Mother's Day no less, we witnessed the owner rudely interacting with a table nearby.  In addition to his unwarranted and unprofessional decorum, the food was overpriced and just so-so.    Despite our poor introduction, I decided to give PC another chance. With a $20 Groupon, I visited with my 4 year old for a quick bite to eat.   After carefully scanning the menu to choose a meal to meet my Groupon, I picked out a blte for me & chocolate milk and a pancake for my child.  (The Groupon just covered these sparse items).  Not a lot of food options for the $20; and once again the food was average.    Here's the part that really rubs me wrong. As we were two steps out the door--my 4 year old son carrying the individual wrapped of crayons available at the hostess desk--was hustled down by the owner who hurried after us to confiscate the crayons from my son.  The sad look on my son's face said it all. We will not be back to the PC.

Went for Mother's Day brunch. Had a reservation at 11:15. The reservation lady could not find our reservation, sent us over to the main entrance claiming we must have a reservation over there. Go over there and find out they are not even doing reservations and reservations are only for the buffet. We didn't even bother to stay, it was so unorganized. Also would like to note that there were at least 10 open tables with about 25 people waiting for "buffet reservations" Not quite sure who was running this today, but it was so unbelievably organized.   Initially I didn't really care for this place but always went because my fianc loves everything about this place. Was very disappointed.

I have been a Pancake Cafe regular since I moved to Madison. They captured me with their great service and awesome crepes.  Sure, it's not a fancy restaurant, but it is warm and homey. We often have the same server and she is nice and attentive.   I originally ordered the spinach crepes, and realized it wasn't for me. They were happy to hook me up with the Blueberry Sour Creme Crepes, and OH HOT DAMN! I dream about those crepes. They are refreshing and delicious. The price is just right for how stuffed I was after eating just part of my crepe plate. They were so amazing, I couldn't stop eating- and I needed to be rolled home afterwards.   Their coffee is simple and a good compliment the the sweet breakfast foods I enjoy. I just tried the Cinnamon French Toast and would recommend  anything that comes with the cream sauce, because that was delicious.   Things that didn't impress me- the cinnamon roll is lack luster, and the sausage links aren't the greasy, spicy breakfast sausage that I like to indulge in.   Overall, good place, good food, large portions. Try it out.

I visited mid-morning on a weekday and had no problem getting a table. It did begin to fill up as the lunch hour approached. Pancake Cafe has a very cozy interior, which is just the way a breakfast place should be. My group ending up lounging and chatting for almost three hours. Our server was very gracious, kept the coffee coming, and never pushed us to leave.  My last visit was in the fall. I got the pancake of the month--pumpkin pancakes! They were good, but only slightly pumpkin-y and otherwise your standard pancake. Next time I think I'll try something with a filling or a topping rather than a flavoring. The hot chocolate was mediocre, definitely not homemade.  The menu is varied enough to satisfy anyone--from sweet to savory, breakfast to lunch, German pancakes to Belgian waffles. Very large portions for decent prices--you can order a half serving for $1.40 less.
